column4: Do anyone know how to can link my Window and Ubuntu together in a share folder?
Thanks imachine but do I have to set it up at Window?
same machine or different machines on same network?
, same machine
mount the windows partitions into /media/ , what FS are they? ntfs or fat32?
fat32, how can I mount it?
hmm, can you tell which /dev/hdXX are your windows partitions?
, hd01
cant be... it should be /dev/hdaX hdbX etc
k, you can also just ls /dev/ | grep hd
, it is hda1 / fat32 flags = boot iba.
cool, ok, create say... /media/winxp, then do mount /dev/hda1 /media/winxp
, thanks so your help so far, may I know how can I do it?
erm, the commands i've just given you should mount it once till you reboot, to have that happen each and every time you can use a script to put that in /etc/fstab
, ok so is there anywhere where I can have that script?
yeah... it's in the last link ubotu just posted... http://www.ubuntulinux.nl/files/diskmounter
my pleasure mate :)

you need to chmod +x <file you just downloaded> and then run it using sh <filename>, you can then edit your fstab file if you dont like the names it's given your partitions. the added bonus is that now your windows partition would appear under the places menu in gnome :)
that works too :)
i had good teachers
